creator: mkoehle
title: Paper Tyhpoon
description: This Instructable documents reproducing a black and white image using laser cut strips of paper. Each paper strip is printed with a gradient, then laser cut to a depth matching a specific column of pixels from the source image. The strips can be thought of as a cross section of the height map of the image.
steps: Write Octave code to sample columns of pixels at a fixed interval and convert the intensities into a vector drawing, saving it as an SVG. Also, create a gradient spanning the strip's width and save it as a JPG.

Laser cut a pattern into 1/4" thick wood panels to guide the gluing of the strips.  Ensure the guide lines are 1/16" apart and vary their appearance to avoid confusion. Back the panels with a frame for support.

Print several gradients on each piece of paper, then laser cut them into strips. Fold each strip at its base at about a 30-degree angle to give it volume. Glue each strip in place following the guide lines.
